news.title: Delhi court grants bail to ex-promoters of DHFL in multi-crore scam
news.para: Additional sessions judge Reetesh Singh, while granting bail on Friday, said: "In the present case as well, the applicant/accused — Kapil Rajesh Wadhawan and Dheeraj Rajesh Wadhawan — were not arrested during the investigation.

news.title: NDMC orders survey in all zones; seeks building plan approval, details from authorities
news.para: The North Delhi civic body also ordered the zonal commissioners to conduct a detailed survey in their areas to find out if any prohibited activity is going on in non-conforming areas to prevent the recurrence of such a tragic incident.

news.title: Proposals for 30 integrated townships, most from Pune Metropolitan Region
news.para: Of them, 12 are in the construction stage. Eight of these townhips are in the Pune region, according to the latest figures available with the town planning department.

news.title: Sundaram Home Finance's net profit up 44.9% to Rs 53.05 crore in Q4 FY22
news.para: The company clocked 44.9 per cent rise on its net profit for the quarter ending March 31, 2022 to Rs 53.05 crore from Rs 36.60 crore registered same period last financial year.

news.title: E-khata now a must for property registration in Bengaluru's 44 wards
news.para: Revenue department officials said it will come into force in 100 wards by the year-end, and in all other wards by 2023.

news.title: Chandigarh: 5% discretionary quota may end for admin in CHB houses
news.para: The UT Administration has given its approval to the recommendation made in the CHB board of directors’ meeting in December 2020, which was held under the chairmanship of former CHB chairman Manoj Parida.

news.title: SC stays HC’s conditional nod to two buildings facing demolition order
news.para: The Supreme Court (SC) bench of Justice Ajay Rastogi and Justice Vikram Nath passed an order to this effect on Friday while hearing a petition by Rakhee Sachdev and other residents of the Clover Highlands Cooperative Housing Society.

news.title: Hike in Ghaziabad circle rate from August?
news.para: TOI has learnt that a survey to this effect will take place from June and the new circle rates could come into effect from August. The area along the Regional Rapid Transit System (RRTS) corridor may see a steep hike in land rates.

news.title: Vadodara: Quarry strike affects civic work, real estate
news.para: The reason for the situation this time around is not civic authorities’ inefficiency, but the strike by the quarries in the state that has started to impact development work and construction activities.

news.title: Gurugram: Building sites likely to get lines for recycled water
news.para: Currently, builders looking to use recycled water at project sites have to hire tankers and fill them from the various hydrants linked to treated wastewater pipelines across the city.

news.title: Greater Noida: Residents, builder to discuss diesel generator price hike
news.para: “The incident was over revised rates of power backup. The two residents’ group engaged in a heated argument. But now, the issue has been settled,” ACP-2 Yogendra Singh said. The two sides will come together to decide on revisions at the next meeting.

news.title: Indiabulls Housing Finance moves NCLT against Radius Estate Projects
news.para: This is the second such plea filed against the realty development company, which is also facing insolvency proceedings in a petition filed by SBICAP Trustee Company Ltd.

news.title: Cidco to hire consultant for generating alternate revenue from Navi Mumbai metro
news.para: Cidco has floated a tender inviting online proposals from internationally experienced and reputed single business entities for appointment as a consultant for assessment of Non-Fare Box Revenue (NFBR) opportunities in Line-1 (Belapur-Pendhar) of Navi Mumbai Metro project.

news.title: Set up university for construction and realty sector courses at NAC: Panel
news.para: The committee, in its report, has recommended that NAC has the funds, land and capacity to set up the university on its campus in the IT corridor. Of the total 40-acre campus, a university can be set up, preferably a private university, in a 20-acre area.

news.title: Welcome decision to give enhanced powers to LPA: CREDAI Coimbatore
news.para: ​CREDAI Coimbatore President Gugan Ilango said the real estate body has been requesting the government to increase the approval powers of the Local Planning Authority.
